title: ECOFIN
topics: Third United Nations Decade for the Eradication of Poverty
description: The Second Committee of the General Assembly of United Nations, also called the Economic and Finance Committee (ECOFIN), is one of the six main committees of the General Assembly. It mainly discusses economic and financial questions related to development and growth. Questions and issues it constantly deals with include macroeconomic policy, finance for development, sustainable development, international trade, international cooperation for development, eradication of poverty, information and technology for development, and industrial and agricultural development. It also pays special attention to developing countries, especially countries in extreme poverty, Least Developed Countries (LDCs) and Landlocked Developing Countries (LLDCs).
